title: Liz Truss v Rishi Sunak: Who's winning the social media war?
description: Liz Truss and Rishi Sunak are very different characters, with very different campaigning styles.

title: The Class of Covid are graduating - here's what uni looked like for them
description: "I wanted to capture the excitement of coming out of Covid - but also how it has left its mark on us."

title: Chemtrails: What's the truth behind the conspiracy theory?
description: A conspiracy theory about aircraft vapour trails takes hold on clear summer mornings.

title: Thirteen Lives: Thai cave rescue actor Tom Bateman relives diving fears
description: Actor Tom Bateman recalls how he overcame his claustrophobia in Ron Howard's film Thirteen Lives.

title: Shinzo Abe killing: Why a religious group has been put in the spotlight
description: The shooter was said to have targeted Shinzo Abe for allegedly having ties to a controversial group.

title: Airport workers on travel problems
description: Pilots, flight attendants and a baggage handler tell us what is happening where they work.

title: Kennel space shortages reported ahead of holidays
description: With dog ownership growing during lockdown, many owners are reporting a shortage of space in kennels.

title: Week in pictures: 16-22 July 2022
description: A selection of powerful images from all over the globe, taken in the past seven days.

title: Resin art social media trend prompts warnings
description: Using epoxy resin to make art has exploded as an online trend, but experts are urging caution about its use.

title: Sweden 1-0 Belgium: Linda Sembrant hits dramatic 92nd-minute winner
description: Sweden left it late to beat Belgium and will need an "extremely good plan" against England in the Euro 2022 semi-finals, says boss Peter Gerhardsson.

title: Pizza delivery man saves children from burning house
description: Nicholas Bostic saved five people from the home, and was hailed as a hero by the police chief.

title: British Airways staff call off Heathrow strike action after new pay offer
description: Hundreds of staff at Heathrow were set to strike over the busy summer holiday period.

title: Sebastian Kalinowski: Mother and partner guilty of murdering teenage son
description: Agnieszka Kalinowska and Andrzej Latoszewski are convicted of killing 15-year-old Sebastian Kalinowski.

title: Commonwealth Games: Prince Charles to speak at opening
description: The Prince of Wales will represent the Queen when the sporting event begins in Birmingham next week.

title: UK Covid cases continuing to rise
description: Latest figures show around 5.8% of the population has coronavirus compared with 5.4% a week earlier.

title: Prince Harry wins bid to challenge security decisions
description: The partial victory means the Duke of Sussex can take the Home Office to court over his UK protection.

title: Czechs demolish pig farm on Nazi concentration camp for Roma
description: More than 300 Roma died at the camp and the farm's demolition ends years of bitter dispute.

title: Ed Sheeran makes video planned with Jamal Edwards
description: Jamal Edwards planned the singer's new music video but died aged 31 before they were able to film it.

title: Capitol riot hearings: Eight key moments
description: Throughout the eight hearings, members have sought a window into Donald Trump's state of mind.

title: Attitudes towards disability: 'Teenagers threatened to tip me out of my wheelchair'
description: From physical threats to patronising comments, attitudes towards disabled people are revealed.

title: Ricky Martin: Judge lifts restraining order on singer after harassment claims, which he denies
description: The singer was accused by a family member of harassment, which he denies, saying it was a "lie".

title: Brexit: UK's divorce bill from EU could rise to £42.5bn
description: A minister says inflation could increase the bill for outstanding UK spending commitments to the EU.

title: Can The Great British Bake Off stage musical serve up a showstopper?
description: The Great British Bake Off stage show opens, but will it replicate the TV hit's recipe for success?

title: NHS waits force patients to pay for private ops
description: People are taking out loans and turning to crowdfunding to pay private medical bills of up to £15,000.

title: Capitol riot: Trump ignored pleas to condemn attack, hearing told
description: The ex-president was "pouring gasoline on the fire" during the Capitol attack, the inquiry hears.

title: Getting into debt for endometriosis surgery
description: Kim Williams says the financial strain of going into debt for surgery has caused her a lot of guilt.

title: Commonwealth Games 2022: Birmingham attempts to leave 'carbon neutral legacy'
description: Organisers are aiming to stage the "most sustainable" Commonwealth Games yet, so how are they doing it and what challenges do they face?

title: Mason: Truss's economic plan remains popular with members
description: The foreign secretary says the economy has been hobbled for 20 years - and the Tory membership seems to agree.

title: Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park: The legacy London 2012 promised
description: What was once a brownfield site is now a tranquil landscape of wetland, woodland and wildflower meadows.

title: Eerie glow in sky confuses Australian town and outs cannabis farm
description: Though soon proven not to be supernatural, the light in the sky did reveal a secret.

title: World Athletics Championships: Dina Asher-Smith dedicates bronze medal to late grandmother
description: Dina Asher-Smith dedicates her bronze medal to her late grandmother after finishing third in the 200m at the World Athletics Championships in Oregon.

title: Chris Pine and Hugh Grant star in the new Dungeons and Dragons movie
description: Chris Pine explains film "easter eggs" to Dungeons and Dragons co-star Hugh Grant

title: World Athletics Championships: Shericka Jackson wins 200m gold with Dina Asher-Smith third
description: A delighted Dina Asher-Smith wins 200m world bronze to return to the major championship podium after a year of personal and physical pain.

title: World Athletics Championships: Dina Asher-Smith wins bronze as Shericka Jackson takes gold
description: Watch as GB's Dina Asher-Smith wins bronze in the women's 200m final with Jamaica's Shericka Jackson winning gold with an impressive time of 21.45 and Shelly-Ann Fraser-Pryce finishing in second place.

title: Climate change: First bill written by children on climate education
description: Teenagers say they want education that reflects how climate change will affect all parts of life.
